Package mysqlConnection

Class mysqlConnection

java.lang.Object
mysqlConnection.mysqlConnection
public class mysqlConnection extends Object
The mysqlConnection class establishes a connection to a MySQL database and provides methods for verifying user logins and other functions.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    mysqlConnection(String dbPath, String dbUsername, String dbPassword)
    Constructs a mysqlConnection object and connects to the specified database.

      dbUsername - the database username
      dbPassword - the database password

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      a Message object indicating login success or failure

      Parameters:

      Adds an order to the waiting list in the database based on the provided Order object.
      Parameters:
      order - the Order object to be added to the waiting list

    • getPlacement

      public int getPlacement(Order order)
      Calculates the placement of an order in the waiting list based on park, date, and time criteria.
      Parameters:
      order - the Order object for which placement is calculated
      Returns:
      the placement position of the order in the waiting list

    • checkWaitingList

      public static void checkWaitingList(Order order)
      This method checks the waiting list for any orders matching the given order's park, time, exit time, and date. If any matching orders are found, they are processed to make reservations and removed from the waiting list. Additionally, notification emails are sent to the respective visitors.
      Parameters:
      order - The order for which the waiting list needs to be checked.

    • deleteOrderFromWaitingList

      public static void deleteOrderFromWaitingList(Order order)
      Deletes the specified order from the waiting list in the database.
      Parameters:
      order - The order to be deleted from the waiting list.

    • getWaitingListTable

      public Message getWaitingListTable(Order order)
      Retrieves the waiting list entries from the database matching the specified order's park, time, exit time, and date. Constructs a Message object containing the waiting list table entries.
      Parameters:
      order - The order for which the waiting list entries need to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A Message object containing the waiting list table entries.

    • getAlternativeDate

      public Message getAlternativeDate(Order order)
      Retrieves alternative dates for reservation based on the provided order's park, time, exit time, and date. The function attempts to find alternative dates within a range of 5 iterations. If a suitable alternative date is found, it is added to the list of alternatives.
      Parameters:
      order - The order for which alternative dates need to be determined.
      Returns:
      A Message object containing the list of alternative Order objects.

    • getAvailablePlaces

      public Message getAvailablePlaces(String parkName)
      Retrieves the number of available places in the specified park. The available places are calculated based on the current occupancy of the park.
      Parameters:
      parkName - The name of the park for which available places are to be determined.
      Returns:
      A Message object containing the number of available places in the park.

    • addUnplannedOrder

      public void addUnplannedOrder(Order order)
      Adds an unplanned order to the database. This method inserts a new order into the database with the provided order details. The order number, date, time, and exit time are automatically generated.
      Parameters:
      order - The unplanned order to be added to the database.

    • approveExit

      public Message approveExit(String orderNumber)
      Approves the exit of a visitor from the park based on the provided order number. If the order number is correct and the visitor is currently inside the park, the exit time is updated to the current time and the order status is set to 'completed'.
      Parameters:
      orderNumber - The order number of the visitor whose exit is to be approved.
      Returns:
      A Message object indicating the status of the exit approval process. If the order number is incorrect or the visitor is not currently inside the park, an error message is returned.

    • checkReservation

      public static Message checkReservation(Order order)
      Checks if a reservation can be made for the provided order. If the number of visitors for the specified park, date, and time exceeds the maximum capacity, the order is added to the waiting list. Otherwise, the reservation is saved successfully.
      Parameters:
      order - The order for which reservation availability is to be checked.
      Returns:
      A Message object indicating the outcome of the reservation check. If the order needs to be added to the waiting list, a WAITINGLIST message is returned. If the reservation can be made successfully, a RESERVATION message is returned.

    • insertReservation

      public static Message insertReservation(Order order)
      Inserts a reservation for the provided order if it meets the criteria. This method first checks the reservation status for the order using the checkReservation method. If the reservation is allowed (i.e., the order does not need to be added to the waiting list), the order details are inserted into the database using the insertOrder method.
      Parameters:
      order - The order for which the reservation is to be inserted.
      Returns:
      A Message object indicating the outcome of the reservation insertion. If the reservation is successful, the returned message will be the same as the one returned by the checkReservation method. If the reservation is not allowed and the order needs to be added to the waiting list, the returned message will be from the checkReservation method.

    • updateReservation

      public Message updateReservation(Order order)
      Updates an existing reservation for the provided order if it meets the criteria. This method first checks the reservation status for the order using the checkReservation method. If the reservation is allowed (i.e., the order does not need to be added to the waiting list), the order details are updated in the database using the updateOrderInfo method.
      Parameters:
      order - The order for which the reservation is to be updated.
      Returns:
      A Message object indicating the outcome of the reservation update. If the update is successful, the returned message will be the same as the one returned by the checkReservation method. If the update is not allowed and the order needs to be added to the waiting list, the returned message will be from the checkReservation method.

    • getParkInfo

      public static Message getParkInfo(String parkName)
      Retrieves information about a park from the database based on the provided park name. This method queries the database to fetch details such as reserved capacity, total capacity, and maximum stay duration for the specified park. It then encapsulates this information into a Park object and returns it within a Message object with ActionType PARKINFO.
      Parameters:
      parkName - The name of the park for which information is to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A Message object containing information about the specified park. If the park is found in the database, the returned message will contain the park details. If the park is not found or an error occurs during database access, an appropriate error message will be returned.

    • updateParkInfo

      public void updateParkInfo(Request request)
      Updates park information in the database based on the provided request. This method executes an SQL update statement to modify the reserved capacity, total capacity, and maximum stay duration for a park identified by its name.
      Parameters:
      request - the request containing updated park information including reserved capacity, total capacity, maximum stay duration, and the name of the park to be updated

    • getRandomOrderNumber

      public static int getRandomOrderNumber()
      Generates a random order number. This method generates a random 8-digit order number and ensures uniqueness by checking if the generated number already exists in the database. If the generated number exists, it generates a new one until a unique number is found.
      Returns:
      a random 8-digit order number

    • updateRoleToGuide

      public Message updateRoleToGuide(User user)
      Updates the role of a user to "GUIDE" in the database. This method updates the user's role to "GUIDE" if the user's current role is "VISITOR".
      Parameters:
      user - the user whose role is to be updated
      Returns:
      a message indicating the success or failure of the role update operation

    • insertRequest

      public void insertRequest(Park park)
      Inserts a new request for a park into the database. This method inserts a new request into the 'requests' table in the database with the provided park's information and sets the status of the request to "waiting for approval".
      Parameters:
      park - the park for which the request is being made

    • updateRequest

      public Message updateRequest(Request request)
      Updates the status of a request in the database. This method updates the status of a request in the 'requests' table in the database based on the provided request's information.
      Parameters:
      request - the request whose status is to be updated
      Returns:
      a message indicating the success or failure of the status update operation

    • getRequestsTable

      public Message getRequestsTable()
      Retrieves requests from the 'requests' table in the database with status "waiting for approval". This method queries the 'requests' table in the database to retrieve requests with the status "waiting for approval", and returns a message containing the list of requests.
      Returns:
      a message containing the list of requests with status "waiting for approval"

    • CreateCancellationReport

      public Message CreateCancellationReport(Report report)
      Creates a cancellation report for a park. This method creates a cancellation report for a park based on the provided report information.
      Parameters:
      report - the report containing park name, month, and year
      Returns:
      a message indicating the success or failure of the report creation operation

    • CreateTotalVisitorsReport

      public Message CreateTotalVisitorsReport(Report report)
      Creates a total visitors report for a park. This method creates a total visitors report for a park based on the provided report information.
      Parameters:
      report - the report containing park name, month, and year
      Returns:
      a message indicating the success or failure of the report creation operation

    • createVisitingReportForVisitorType

      public void createVisitingReportForVisitorType(Report report, String visitorType)
      Creates a visiting report for a specified visitor type and inserts it into the database. This method generates a visiting report for a specified visitor type and inserts the report data into the 'visitingreport' table in the database.
      Parameters:
      report - the report containing park name, month, and year
      visitorType - the type of visitor for whom the report is being created

    • createVisitingReport

      public Message createVisitingReport(Report report)
      Creates a visiting report for a park for both individual/family visitors and organized groups. This method creates a visiting report for a park based on the provided report information. It generates separate reports for individual/family visitors and organized groups.
      Parameters:
      report - the report containing park name, month, and year
      Returns:
      a message indicating the success or failure of the report creation operation

    • createUsageReport

      public Message createUsageReport(Report report)
      Creates a usage report for a park based on the provided report information. This method generates a usage report for a park based on the provided report information, calculating full and not full counts for each time range.
      Parameters:
      report - the report containing park name, month, and year
      Returns:
      a message indicating the success or failure of the report creation operation

    • getIndexOfStringInArrayList

      public static int getIndexOfStringInArrayList(String timeRange, ArrayList<UsageVisitingReport> usageList)
      Retrieves the index of a specified time range string in an ArrayList of UsageVisitingReport objects.
      Parameters:
      timeRange - the time range string to search for
      usageList - the ArrayList of UsageVisitingReport objects to search within
      Returns:
      the index of the specified time range string in the ArrayList; returns -1 if not found

      Parameters:
      reportType - the type of the report (e.g., "UsageReport" or "VisitingReport")
      Returns:
      a unique report ID as a string

    • calculateTotalVisitors

      public int calculateTotalVisitors(Order order)

      Parameters:
      order - the order containing information about the park, time, date, and number of visitors
      Returns:
      the total number of visitors for the given order's time range

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the calculated time range in HH:mm-HH:mm format

      Returns:

    • deleteHostInfo

      public void deleteHostInfo(String ip)
      This method deletes client details from the database based on the IP address.
      Parameters:
